alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 4:47AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko NV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nevada... Bruneau River At Rowland affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. Any rain showers that occur may also add to river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. The combination of continued snowmelt and rain showers may sustain flooding conditions. * WHERE...Bruneau River At Rowland. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding of Forest Service roads. Recreational use becomes limited. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:10 AM PDT Monday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:10 AM PDT Monday was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
